questions.question: She is senior ................................... me by five years.
questions.description: The adjectives senior and junior are followed by the preposition to.

questions.question: My job is superior ..................................... yours.
questions.description: The adjectives superior and inferior are followed by the preposition to.

questions.question: James is ........................................  his brother.
questions.description: We use the comparative to compare one person or thing with another person or thing.

questions.question: She sings ......................................... as her sister.
questions.description: We use constructions with as...as... to say that two persons or things are similar.

questions.question: I earn as ..................................... money as you do.
questions.description: Adjectives or adverbs of the positive degree are used in this construction.

questions.question: Samuel is ........................................ of the four boys.
questions.description: We use the superlative to compare one or thing with the group to which that person or thing also belongs.

questions.question: I am quite …………………………….. with what I have achieved.
questions.description: We use the positive adjective when there is no idea of comparison.

questions.question: This is …………………………… difficult problem I have ever encountered.
questions.description: We make the superlative form of difficult with most. The article the is used before superlative adjectives.

questions.question: You are …………………………… woman I have ever met.
questions.description: The superlative form of kind is kindest.

questions.question: I am …………………………….. in movies than concerts.
